intro: Barleria boehmii, commonly known as red barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Barleria boehmii thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
